document_data.name: Giftu Hudd
document_data.mainbody:
'''Giftu Hudd''' was a [[gold dwarf]] commoner, displaced by [[The Absolute]], and as a refugee, sought shelter in [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''The army of the Absolute at your back certainly encourages a brisk pace. Look at those walls! No better city to weather the army of the Absolute in.''|Giftu Hudd}}
document_data.Description: Giftu had a pale skin, bulbous nose, and light brown beard. He wore a simple [[leather]] [[skullcap]] and a leather [[jerkin]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, an army assembled by the [[Cult of the Absolute]] moved from the [[Moonrise Towers]] in [[Chionthar Valley]] to menace the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], displacing countless refugees in the process along the way. Giftu Hudd and his sibling found their way to the city walls and were allowed to enter the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]], unlike many other refugees who were refused entrance due to lack of [[coin]] or paperwork. Giftu was happy to be protected by the city walls, confident their could withstand the Absolutist siege.
